citations.narrative:
Since the last inspection, the facility is still not ensuring that the Patagonian cavies housed together are compatible. Per
the facility representative, once they removed and separated the younger male cavy that was actively being chased by
the older male cavy during the previous inspection on 3/12/25, a different young male cavy within the same shared
enclosure was found seriously injured on 3/13/25. According to the facility representative, the injuries were due to
aggression from the older male and this younger male was euthanized by a veterinarian because of these injuries. The
facility is now housing the older male cavy alone.
Housing incompatible animals together in the same primary enclosure can lead to stress, injury, and even death. Animals
housed in the same primary enclosure must be compatible.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
n

narrative:
3.133  Critical Repeat
   
Separation. 
Since the last inspection, the facility is still not ensuring that the Patagonian cavies housed together are compatible. Per 
the facility representative, once they removed and separated the younger male cavy that was actively being chased by 
the older male cavy during the previous inspection on 3/12/25, a different young male cavy within the same shared 
enclosure was found seriously injured on 3/13/25. According to the facility representative, the injuries were due to 
aggression from the older male and this younger male was euthanized by a veterinarian because of these injuries. The 
facility is now housing the older male cavy alone.  
Housing incompatible animals together in the same primary enclosure can lead to stress, injury, and even death. Animals 
housed in the same primary enclosure must be compatible. 
 
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with facility representatives.
